notes: Common fermented maize porridge widely consumed; maize is a key staple in Nigeria (FAO background)
General maize-based foods/snacks are common; maize is a staple (FAO background)
Codex/FAO definition for soybean beverages (“soymilk”) used for human consumption
Soy foods for direct human consumption (general)
Typical poultry rations in Nigeria use maize + soybean meal (peer-reviewed review)
Layer feeds rely on maize + soybean meal (same reference)
USDA Oilseeds report: soy supply context; edible oils often include soybean oil
Commercial release of TELA GM maize approved Jan 2024 (policy context)
Nigeria commercialized pod-borer-resistant cowpea in 2019 (policy context)
Popular street food made from cowpea paste; Nigeria commercialized GMO cowpea (PBR cowpea)
Traditional dish made from cowpea paste; links to GMO cowpea adoption in Nigeria
Common Nigerian dish; often cooked with vegetable oil blends that may contain soy or cottonseed oil
Chicken feed relies on maize and soy; dish combines rice with poultry products linked to GMO feed
Cattle feed in Nigeria often includes maize and soybean meal
